text.0: the godlike hero famousest of nobles hath granted me two oxen with a wagon.
text.1: trvrsans son tryaruna hath distinguished himself vaiśvānara agni with ten thousands.
text.2: protect tryaruna as thou art waxing strong and art highly praised vaiśvānara agni.
text.3: who granteth me a hundred kine and twenty and two bay horses good at draught and harnessed.
text.4: so trasadasyu served thee god most youthful craving thy favour for the ninth time agni.
text.5: tryaruya who with attentive spirit accepteth many a song from me the mighty.
text.6: he who declares his wish to me to asvamedha to the prince.
text.7: pays him who with his verse seeks gain gives power to him who keeps the law.
text.8: from whom a hundred oxen all of speckled hue delight my heart.
text.9: the gifts of asvamedha like thricemingled draughts of soma juice.
text.10: to asvamedha who bestows a hundred gifts grant hero power.
text.11: o indraagni lofty rule like the unwasting sun in heaven.
